results.title: Antihypertensive treatment improves glycemic control in patients with newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes mellitus: A prospective cohort study
results.text_hl: Antihypertensive treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ in addition to standard @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ therapy improves glycemic control in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@.

results.title: Treatment of calcium channel blocker-induced gingival overgrowth without modifying medication.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ had been on @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ (40 mg/day) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (10 mg/day) medication for 5 years.

results.title: A study about the relevance of adding acetylsalicylic acid in primary prevention in subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus: effects on some new emerging biomarkers of cardiovascular risk
results.text_hl: 213 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ were randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 5 mg, or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 5 mg + @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@ASA@@@ 100 mg for 3 months (Phase A); then, if adequate blood pressure control was reached @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ terminated the study; otherwise, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ was up-titrated to 10 mg/day for further 3 months and compared to @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 10 mg + @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@ASA@@@ 100 mg (Phase B).

citations.NLM: Derosa G, Mugellini A, Pesce RM, D'Angelo A, Maffioli P. A study about the relevance of adding acetylsalicylic acid in primary prevention in subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus: effects on some new emerging biomarkers of cardiovascular risk Cardiovasc Diabetol. 2015 Jul 30;14():95. PMID: 26223257

results.title: Effects of valsartan and amlodipine on oxidative stress in type 2 diabetic patients with hypertension: a randomized, multicenter study
results.text_hl: There was a Japanese study showing that @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ decreased oxidative stress in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@.
